SEARCH
Package bn.parser

Class BIFParser

java.lang.Object
bn.parser.BIFParser
public class BIFParser extends Object
A Bison parser, automatically generated from BIFParser.y.

  • Constructor Details

    • BIFParser

      public BIFParser(BIFParser.Lexer yylexer)
      Instantiates the Bison-generated parser.
      Parameters:
      yylexer - The scanner that will supply tokens to the parser.

    • BIFParser

      public BIFParser(InputStream input)
      Construct and return a new BIFParser whose input is the given InputStream. Invokes automatically-generated constructor that takes a Lexer as parameter.

  • Method Details

    • getDebugStream

      public final PrintStream getDebugStream()
      Return the PrintStream on which the debugging output is printed.

    • setDebugStream

      public final void setDebugStream(PrintStream s)
      Set the PrintStream on which the debug output is printed.
      Parameters:
      s - The stream that is used for debugging output.

    • getDebugLevel

      public final int getDebugLevel()
      Answer the verbosity of the debugging output; 0 means that all kinds of output from the parser are suppressed.

    • setDebugLevel

      public final void setDebugLevel(int level)
      Set the verbosity of the debugging output; 0 means that all kinds of output from the parser are suppressed.
      Parameters:
      level - The verbosity level for debugging output.

    • yyerror

      protected final void yyerror(String s)

    • yycdebug

      protected final void yycdebug(String s)

    • recovering

      public final boolean recovering()
      Return whether error recovery is being done. In this state, the parser reads token until it reaches a known state, and then restarts normal operation.

    • parse

      public boolean parse() throws IOException, ParserException
      Parse input from the scanner that was specified at object construction time. Return whether the end of the input was reached successfully.
      Returns:
      true if the parsing succeeds. Note that this does not imply that there were no syntax errors.
      Throws:
      IOException
      ParserException

    • recoverFromError

      public void recoverFromError() throws IOException
      Attempt to recover from a parsing error. This is unlikely to work in its current state, but what the hey.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • parseNetwork

      public BayesianNetwork parseNetwork() throws IOException
      Parse and return a BayesianNetwork from this BIFParser's input. This method wraps a call to the basic Bison-generated parse() method.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • main

      public static void main(String[] argv) throws IOException
      Parse a BIF file and print out the resulting BayesianNetwork.

      Usage: java bn.parser.BIFParser FILE

      With no arguments: reads dog-problem.bif in the src tree

      Throws:
      IOException

    • defineVariable

      protected void defineVariable(String name, BIFParser.VariableContentItemList items)

    • defineProbability

      protected void defineProbability(BIFParser.StringList variableNames, BIFParser.ProbabilityContentEntryList entries) throws ParserException
      entries is a List of: ProbabilityEntry or ProbabilityDefaultEntry or ProbabilityTable

      Not sure how to handle errors here... Should check manual...

      Throws:
      ParserException

    • defineProbabilityTableEntry

      protected void defineProbabilityTableEntry(CPT cpt, Value value, Assignment a, List<RandomVariable> givens, Iterator<Double> ptvalues)
      Recursively traverses givens in the order they were declared (ie., their order in the list), iterating through each of their values, assigning probabilities from ptvalues at the leaves.

      protected void trace(String msg)
